description:
Larry David, who is worth hundreds of millions of dollars, has decided that anyone who disagrees with him is a de facto Nazi. And while no one asked for his irrelevant opinion, this nonsense is exactly why the American people no longer support the left.

Journalist Batya Ungar-Sargon blasted David for mocking Bill Maher for daring to have dinner with literally Hitler.

When you call Trump Hitler, you're calling the majority of Americans making under $100K a year Nazis—for the crime of refusing to cosign their disinheritance. Multi-millionaire liberals sneer at and smear the working class for wanting a future for their kids. It's disgusting. pic.twitter.com/qduGTBygYp
— Batya Ungar-Sargon (@bungarsargon)
title: Former Dem reporter UNLOADS on the left's latest attacks comparing Trump and his supporters to Hitler: "It's disgusting"

description:
The left lost the election, but rather than respect that fact and finally listen to the will of the people, they are doing everything in their power to “run out the clock.” No matter the policy, it always seems as if an activist judge is here to rain on the Trump parade. So, while no one voted for these left-wing activists, the Dems have used it to shut down everything they despise, which includes you.

This is why Scott Jennings said what needed to be said.

Just this week, judges (carefully shopped by Democrats) have ruled Trump may not:

-Deport illegal alien gang members
-Require voters to prove they're citizens
-Defund sanctuary cities that violate federal law

The plan is obvious: Run out the clock on the Trump presidency.
title: Scott Jennings goes scorched Earth on Democrats' latest judicial warfare against Trump's agenda: "The plan is obvious"

description:
While the left can’t seem to agree that illegal immigration is an objectively bad thing, you would think they would at least stop defending those accused of terrible crimes. However, that is not the case. Today’s show breaks down one of the worst takes and misinformation the media had on immigration this week.

It took a lot for the media to find their poster child to help prove that deportation is evil, and the best they could do was get Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a suspected MS-13 gang member.
title: Watch: NY Times Goes Full Simp Over Deported Jamaican Kidnapper

description:
Montana cops are having fun on the job, so it’s time to step in and stop it. The media is wrong about…well, a lot, frankly, so let’s look at some of the bad takes and misinformation on immigration this week. The news media is making it sound like Texas governor Greg Abbott is helping developers build communities that house illegals. But is he really?

MONTANA COP BINGO

  • CowboyStateDaily
title: Sources: NY Times Goes Full Simp for Deported Jamaican Kidnapper

description:
Here we go again. Another radical progressive federal judge ruled against Donald Trump's America First agenda. This time, it's DC Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly blocking Trump's attempt to require proof of citizenship in order to vote. Yes. A federal judge says it's unconstitutional to require proof you're allowed to vote in order to vote.

Side note: It's a conspiracy theory to say Democrats support open border policies in order to import new Democrat voters.

From the ruling:

In a 120-page opinion, U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly blocked the Trump administration from requiring proof of citizenship to register to vote and ordering that election officials “assess” the citizen
title: Another AWFL judge (with an anti-Christian past) has ruled against Trump's America First agenda to protect election integrity

description:
Thursday night was the opening of the 2025 NFL Draft. It was a good night for the New York Giants fans in my group chat (shouts to them). It was a bad night for Shedeur Sanders. The highlight was Donald Trump's "cameo," if you will. I say "cameo" with finger quotes because the President was in DC making America great again, but his presence was felt, as was the tightening of Roger Goodell's sphincter when "Trump" was spoken.

The event took place in Green Bay and was opened up by Packers legend (and star of Pitch Perfect 2) Clay Matthews, who had just gotten off the phone with one President Donald J. Trump. The former Linebacker was asked to relay a message.

— (@)
title: Donald Trump makes a "cameo" at the NFL Draft in the way of a hilarious joke at the expense of Chicago Bears fans
